thread.section_title: WABI | Maine Local News, Weather, Sports | Bangor, ME
thread.title: Strong winter storm on Saturday

author: @WABI_TV5
title: Strong winter storm on Saturday
text: Strong winter storm on Saturday BANGOR, Maine (WABI) - A low pressure system continues its trek into the Northeast. After a sunny day Friday, clouds will build into the state ahead of the storm. Snow will cross the New Hampshire/Maine border just after midnight and move north and east. Snow should begin in the Bangor area between 3-6 a.m. The heaviest snow will fall during the daytime hours with snow falling at rate of 1-2″ per hour at times. The highest snowfall amounts will be north and west where an average of 10-15″ is predicted with pockets of 15-20″+. The foothills and the interstate area between Augusta and Bangor is in the 6-10″ range. The coast is in the 3-6″ range. Snow will transition to a mix south and east of the interstate mid to late Saturday afternoon. This will bring up to an inch of sleet for areas along and near the interstate from the Bangor area and south. A quarter inch of ice may accumulate as well with freezing rain. Coastal Downeast will see a changeover to heavy rain and could pick up 2-2.5″ of rain. The system will move out late Saturday night and high pressure will move in. Mostly sunny conditions are expected on Sunday, but the wind will pick up; expect northwest winds to gust to 35 mph. Partly cloudy skies are forecast for Monday and Tuesday with highs near or slightly below normal. TONIGHT: Cloudy. Snow starts after 2 a.m. Lows 11-23°. West wind 5-10 mph SATURDAY: Snow west and north. Snow, mix & rain south. Highs 24-41°. Northeast wind 5-15 mph. SUNDAY: Mostly sunny. Highs in the 30s. Northwest wind 10-20 mph with gusts to 35 mph. MONDAY: Partly cloudy. Highs in the 30s. North-northeast wind 5-15 mph. TUESDAY: Partly cloudy. Highs in the upper 30s to low 40s. Northeast wind 5-15 mph. WEDNESDAY: Cloudy with possible showers. Highs in the mid 30s to low 40s. East wind 5-10 mph. Copyright 2024 WABI. All rights reserved.
